HEB 11:31.text: By faith Rahab the prostitute didn’t perish with those who were disobedient, having received the spies in peace.

HEB 11:32.text: What more shall I say? For the time would fail me if I told of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, Samuel, and the prophets—

HEB 11:33.text: who through faith subdued kingdoms, worked out righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

HEB 11:34.text: quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness were made strong, grew mighty in war, and caused foreign armies to flee.

HEB 11:35.text: Women received their dead by resurrection. Others were tortured, not accepting their deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection.

HEB 11:36.text: Others were tried by mocking and scourging, yes, moreover by bonds and imprisonment.

HEB 11:37.text: They were stoned. They were sawn apart. They were tempted. They were slain with the sword. They went around in sheep skins and in goat skins; being destitute, afflicted, ill-treated—

HEB 11:38.text: of whom the world was not worthy—wandering in deserts, mountains, caves, and the holes of the earth.

HEB 11:39.text: These all, having been commended for their faith, didn’t receive the promise,

HEB 11:40.text: God having provided some better thing concerning us, so that apart from us they should not be made perfect.

JAS 1:1.text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ,to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings.

JAS 1:2.text: Count it all joy, my brothers,when you fall into various temptations,

JAS 1:3.text: knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.

JAS 1:4.text: Let endurance have its perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.

JAS 1:5.text: But if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach, and it will be given to him.

JAS 1:6.text: But let him ask in faith, without any doubting, for he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed.

JAS 1:7.text: For that man shouldn’t think that he will receive anything from the Lord.

JAS 1:8.text: He is a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways.

JAS 1:9.text: Let the brother in humble circumstances glory in his high position;

JAS 1:10.text: and the rich, in that he is made humble, because like the flower in the grass, he will pass away.

JAS 1:11.text: For the sun arises with the scorching wind and withers the grass; and the flower in it falls, and the beauty of its appearance perishes. So the rich man will also fade away in his pursuits.

JAS 1:12.text: Blessed is a person who endures temptation, for when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life which the Lord promised to those who love him.

JAS 1:13.text: Let no man say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,” for God can’t be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one.

JAS 1:14.text: But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust and enticed.

JAS 1:15.text: Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin. The sin, when it is full grown, produces death.

JAS 1:16.text: Don’t be deceived, my beloved brothers.

JAS 1:17.text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom can be no variation nor turning shadow.

JAS 1:18.text: Of his own will he gave birth to us by the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures.

JAS 1:19.text: So, then, my beloved brothers, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger;

JAS 1:20.text: for the anger of man doesn’t produce the righteousness of God.

JAS 1:21.text: Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.

JAS 1:22.text: But be doers of the word, and not only hearers, deluding your own selves.

JAS 1:23.text: For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a mirror;

JAS 1:24.text: for he sees himself, and goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was.

JAS 1:25.text: But he who looks into the perfect law of freedom and continues, not being a hearer who forgets but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in what he does.

JAS 1:26.text: If anyone among you thinks himself to be religious while he doesn’t bridle his tongue, but deceives his heart, this man’s religion is worthless.

JAS 1:27.text: Pure religion and undefiled before our God and Father is this: to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained by the world.

REV 21:1.text: I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth have passed away, and the sea is no more.

REV 21:2.text: I saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared like a bride adorned for her husband.

REV 21:3.text: I heard a loud voice out of heaven saying, “Behold, God’s dwelling is with people; and he will dwell with them, and they will be his people, and God himself will be with them as their God.

REV 21:4.text: He will wipe away every tear from their eyes. Death will be no more; neither will there be mourning, nor crying, nor pain any more. The first things have passed away.”

REV 21:5.text: He who sits on the throne said,He said,

REV 21:9.text: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls which were loaded with the seven last plagues came, and he spoke with me, saying, “Come here. I will show you the bride, the Lamb’s wife.”

REV 21:10.text: He carried me away in the Spirit to a great and high mountain, and showed me the holy city, Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God,

REV 21:11.text: having the glory of God. Her light was like a most precious stone, like a jasper stone, clear as crystal;

REV 21:12.text: having a great and high wall with twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and names written on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the children of Israel.

REV 21:13.text: On the east were three gates, and on the north three gates, and on the south three gates, and on the west three gates.

REV 21:14.text: The wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them twelve names of the twelve Apostles of the Lamb.

REV 21:15.text: He who spoke with me had for a measure a golden reed to measure the city, its gates, and its walls.

REV 21:16.text: The city is square. Its length is as great as its width. He measured the city with the reed: twelve thousand twelve stadia.Its length, width, and height are equal.

REV 21:17.text: Its wall is one hundred forty-four cubits,by the measure of a man, that is, of an angel.

REV 21:18.text: The construction of its wall was jasper. The city was pure gold, like pure glass.

REV 21:19.text: The foundations of the city’s wall were adorned with all kinds of precious stones. The first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire,the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald,

REV 21:20.text: the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardius, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh jacinth, and the twelfth amethyst.

REV 21:21.text: The twelve gates were twelve pearls. Each one of the gates was made of one pearl. The street of the city was pure gold, like transparent glass.

REV 21:22.text: I saw no temple in it, for the Lord God the Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.

REV 21:23.text: The city has no need for the sun or moon to shine, for the very glory of God illuminated it and its lamp is the Lamb.

REV 21:24.text: The nations will walk in its light. The kings of the earth bring the glory and honor of the nations into it.

REV 21:25.text: Its gates will in no way be shut by day (for there will be no night there),

REV 21:26.text: and they shall bring the glory and the honor of the nations into it so that they may enter.

REV 21:27.text: There will in no way enter into it anything profane, or one who causes an abomination or a lie, but only those who are written in the Lamb’s book of life.

REV 22:1.text: He showed me ariver of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb,

REV 22:2.text: in the middle of its street. On this side of the river and on that was the tree of life, bearing twelve kinds of fruits, yielding its fruit every month. The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.

REV 22:3.text: There will be no curse any more. The throne of God and of the Lamb will be in it, and his servants will serve him.

REV 22:4.text: They will see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads.

REV 22:5.text: There will be no night, and they need no lamp light or sun light; for the Lord God will illuminate them. They will reign forever and ever.

REV 22:6.text: He said to me, “These words are faithful and true. The Lord God of the spirits of the prophets sent his angel to show to his bondservants the things which must happen soon.”

REV 22:8.text: Now I, John, am the one who heard and saw these things. When I heard and saw, I fell down to worship before the feet of the angel who had shown me these things.

REV 22:9.text: He said to me, “You must not do that! I am a fellow bondservant with you and with your brothers, the prophets, and with those who keep the words of this book. Worship God.”

REV 22:10.text: He said to me, “Don’t seal up the words of the prophecy of this book, for the time is at hand.

REV 22:11.text: He who acts unjustly, let him act unjustly still. He who is filthy, let him be filthy still. He who is righteous, let him do righteousness still. He who is holy, let him be holy still.”

REV 22:17.text: The Spirit and the bride say, “Come!” He who hears, let him say, “Come!” He who is thirsty, let him come. He who desires, let him take the water of life freely.

REV 22:18.text: I testify to everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: if anyone adds to them, God will add to him the plagues which are written in this book.

REV 22:19.text: If anyone takes away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God will take away his part from the treeof life, and out of the holy city, which are written in this book.

REV 22:20.text: He who testifies these things says,Amen! Yes, come, Lord Jesus!

REV 22:21.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with all the saints. Amen.
